title: Reverse Linked List
description:
Given the head of a singly linked list, reverse the list, and return the reversed list.

Example:
  Input: 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5
  Output: 5 -> 4 -> 3 -> 2 -> 1

Constraints:
- The number of nodes in the list is in the range [0, 5000]
- -5000 <= Node.val <= 5000
test_code:
require 'minitest/autorun'
require_relative 'solution'

def to_linked(arr)
  head = nil
  arr.reverse.each { |v| head = ListNode.new(v, head) }
  head
end

def to_array(head)
  result = []
  while head
    result << head.val
    head = head.next_node
  end
  result
end

class TestReverseLinkedList < Minitest::Test
  def test_basic
    assert_equal [5,4,3,2,1], to_array(reverse_list(to_linked([1,2,3,4,5])))
  end
  def test_two
    assert_equal [2,1], to_array(reverse_list(to_linked([1,2])))
  end
  def test_empty
    assert_nil reverse_list(nil)
  end
end
